title: Plant-based and cell-based approaches to meat production
description: Detailed analysis of benefits and challenges of plant‑based and cellular meat alternatives—including efficiency, sensory characteristics, and sustainability implications.

title: Sustainability of Alternatives to Animal Protein Sources, a …
description: Review focused on sustainable food production and diets, evaluating alternative protein sources in the context of intensive animal agriculture impacts.

title: The environmental sustainability of meat‑based versus … pet food
description: A review of life‑cycle assessments comparing pet‑food types—meat‑based vs vegan—and mitigation strategies to reduce environmental impacts.

title: Considering how farm animal welfare concerns may guide consumers
description: Examines how consumer behavior can be influenced toward more sustainable and animal‑friendly food systems.

title: Evidence: plant-based animal product alternatives are more sustainable
description: Data showing plant‑based alternatives (PB‑APAs) consistently outperform animal products in GHG, land and water footprint.

title: Consumers’ Attitudes towards Animal Suffering
description: Systematic review of 90 studies on consumers’ awareness of animal pain and suffering in animal agriculture.

title: The End of Factory Farming
description: Bioethical analysis of phasing out industrial factory farms (CAFOs), arguing an overhaul of intensive farming is overdue.

title: Plant and insect proteins support optimal bone growth…
description: Pre‑clinical rat study evaluating growth and microbiome effects of diets based on plant and insect proteins versus dairy casein.

title: Sustainability benefits of transitioning from current diets to plant‑based diets
description: Quantifies reductions in GHG (30–52 %), land use (20–45 %) and freshwater use (14–27 %) from plant‑based diet adoption.

title: Sustainability of plant‑based diets: back to the future
description: Classic review on why plant‑based diets are more resource‑efficient and environmentally sustainable than animal‑product‑rich diets.

title: Perceived motivators and barriers to consuming a plant‑based diet
description: 2025 qualitative study exploring facilitators (affordable access, support) and barriers (lack of education, availability, skills) in diet transition.

title: Barriers to Adopting a Plant‑Based Diet in High‑Income Countries
description: Systematic review identifying 40 barriers in 11 thematic groups: financial, social norms, health concerns, convenience, enjoyment of meat, etc.

title: Adolescents’ willingness to adopt a more plant‑based diet
description: Interview-based study showing low awareness, perceived poor taste, and lack of cooking skills limit adoption among teenagers.

title: Plant‑based and sustainable diet: A systematic review
description: 2025 systematic review linking sustainable diet frameworks with environmental, dietary quality and public health outcomes.

title: The Future of Plant‑Based Diets: Aligning Healthy and Sustainable Eating
description: Expert review (2024) on integrated definitions of sustainable diets and the policy levers to advance them.

title: Meat‑Free Day Reduces GHG Emissions but Poses Adherence Challenges
description: Field experiment showing weekly Meat‑Free Days cut emissions by ~53 %, improve fiber and cholesterol, but adherence drops off after treated days.
